Reviews.Title: “Overall good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SnowshineWalesUK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the Ciudad Lineal Metro station (green line). Very handy as visiting all the major attractions via the metro is so quick and easy. The area has many shops, supermarkets, cafes and restaurants and seemed quiet safe even late at night. Our room on the second floor was a good size and very clean. The room is serviced daily. The only downside was that the sofa bed was not very comfortable. There is free wifi available, you have to ask for an access code & password at the front desk. (Staff are very friendly and helpful). You will need one for each device you have. There was a laptop in the room which is free to use. The breakfast (buffet style) we thought expensive at 15.10 euros for adults and 3 euro for children. If you have a late departure you can leave your cases and return later to collect them. All in all we would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: newlifeinn
Reviews.Content: Great location near Ciudad Lineal metro Station, Good buffet breakfast, Free parking (small) Shops and restaurants near the hotel, Free Wireless internet with a netbook each room. It's an excellent choice with a very good location

Reviews.Title: “It was a place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: KeltieJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing special. The location isn't really close to anything although is on the train line so we were able to get downtown fairly easily. It costs 25EUR to take a taxi from the airport. The wifi only works in the lobby, there is no pool, the high tech shower didn't work properly at all. The hotel was only 50 EUR a night though, so you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Muy bueno”
Reviews.Author: Spartanza
Reviews.Content: Circa 20 mins by metro or less by cab I think this hotel is perfectly situated for your visit to central Madrid. Very close to the metro , clean efficient and friendly. Part of the Spanish group Recommended without doubt Mr Van Davies of old London Town

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Patrick M
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 weeks here on business. The rooms are clean and up to date. The staff could not have been nicer, they could not do enough for you. Very Convenient to the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: Oscar456
Reviews.Content: loved the location, near metro, bars, mall and supermarkets. had a blast in the neighborhood.Hotel staff was great and the service was very good. Will go back without any hesitation, nothing bad to say about the hotel,cant wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Good location, some hiccups in visiting experience”
Reviews.Author: hmart61
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the High Tech, Madrid for 2 nights before returning to San Francisco. It promised exactly what I needed. -The hotel is situated within a block of a Metro station (Ciudad Lineal). This was important because I wanted to visit the Prado and Thyssen Museums (a total of 8 stops away, with one transfer in the middle, from the museums) -There was free onsite parking. Although the parking area is small and it was full when I checked in, street parking is close and unrestricted. -Free wifi is included, notebook computer in every room. -Close to Barrajas Airport, since I was leaving soon. Some hiccups to my visiting experience: - The in room notebook computer was not working, at booking I was promised a bottle of wine at check in, but no wine :(. My own notebook was unable to connect to the wifi, but I connected through the LAN cable... All in all, I liked the hotel and staff. If the hiccups were not there, it would have been a 5 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Abe M
Reviews.Content: Very good experience. Staff was very friendly and helped answer all my questions. Rooms very clean and house keeping was"Top Notch"! Very close to airport and nice area. Shopping Mall across the street was nice. Close to Metro. Would very much recommend this Hotel to anyone staying in Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Cozy”
Reviews.Author: Florida50Couple
Reviews.Content: This is a no frills hotel but reasonable rates and they let us check in early when we arrived from our intl flight. The wifi is free but slow and we got a good enough signal using our laptop, but not with our smart phones. The "free" breakfast comes on the higher rate rooms (same rooms, just higher rate), so i reccommend not getting it as its not that much more than a continental breakfast anyway. Also just a block or two to the left out the front is a shopping center with grocery store in the lower floor. Its easy to buy yoghurt or pastries or fruit there and bring it back to have in your room. Do not take a taxi to the airport. The front desk had an "arranged" rate of $35 euro-$ 46 us dollars to go. I walked to the metro (by the shopping center..only a block and a half) took the green line 2 stops away from madrid center ..then caught the bus that goes direct to terminal 4 at mad airport.. very easy and only 30 min. It was 1.5 euro for the metro and 1.5 or 2 for the bus. They have free parking if you rent a car, but only about 8 spaces. Street parking is nearby. This is a nice neighborhood with lots of restaurants nearby, but too far from using this as a hotel to tour central madrid from. Better off using Holiday Inn Plaza Castellanas and take the 150 bus right into the heart of the area.

Reviews.Title: “Highish Tech Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Worldlywisdom
Reviews.Content: This is a good, modern hotel in a Madrid suburb. Handy if driving in, and if you're happy to use the metro to get into the city centre. Lobby: When we stayed, the two free PCs and printer weren't working! This was rectified later by the very helpful staff. There are laptops in the room anyway. Late check-in not a problem and was able to extend checkout until 1pm. Rooms: Good size, TV, laptop provided with free internet access (thus the 'High Tech' in the title I guess). Not sure about wi-fi, but didn't need it. There are also massage jets in the shower cubicle, which some may find exciting I guess. Parking: The hotel car park was full when we arrived. However on the weekend, it seems like street parking is all free, and we had little difficulty parking just off Arturo Soria down the road from the hotel. It only took about 10-15 minutes to get on to the Autovia from here (on a Sunday though!) Metro: About 2-3 minutes' walk to Ciudad Lineal in a residential area. There's a small shopping centre at the same crossroads too. The metro takes about 25 minutes to get into central Madrid (directly to Opera and La Latina).

Reviews.Title: “So sad to say adios to Madrid...”
Reviews.Author: klasallejr
Reviews.Content: 3 of us stayed here in a family room and spent a total of 280 Euros for 3 nights, which isn't bad at all! Staff spoke English and was very helpful with accommodating us with anything we needed (to print info, call a taxi and even printed us directions to a bar we were looking for after we called down to the front desk). There's also an Irish restaurant right outside the hotel & we loved it! Hotel is located right near a metro stop so it was easy to jump on and go wherever we wanted. ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel for business trip - but lacking character”
Reviews.Author: Sinbad02
Reviews.Content: The hotel was conveniently located for my business trip and only 10-15 minutes drive from the airport. Meals are not served by the hotel but there is a charming galician restaurant within 5 minutes walking distance of the hotel called La Lanzada Cocina Gallega. The rooms are a good size and my stay was peaceful enough. As I bought my own laptop I was given a print out code to use for free internet access. The bathroom had a large cheap-looking plastic unit in the corner of the shower that once upon a time was a water massager. However it was no longer working apart from delivering a harsh jet of water from the shower head rather than a relaxing spray. The breakfast was adequate but certainly not worth the 22 euros extra cost (in total I paid €89) for 1 night. All in all this hotel was fine but I will probably look around for an alternative next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic 2.5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: austinmamatwoboys
Reviews.Content: I think the pictures and reviewers are being generous with the compliments of this hotel. I don't like when hotels try to be something they are not. This is not a four star hotel, a three star at best. I will review pros and cons: pros: metro stop is very close, ac works very well in the room, bed is somewhat comfortable cons: halls don't have ac, elevator is tiny, showers are horrible with mold and bad tile installation. The bathrooms have "faux marble" tile the kind that is pixalated with a picture of marble. The front desk was not helpful. They sent us to the wrong metro stop, they couldn't call us a cab and they couldn't tell us a restaurant in walking distance of the hotel. We only paid $75 Euro for the room with the double bed and pull out couch and I wouldn't return here.

Reviews.Title: “Good value Hotel in a safe area”
Reviews.Author: ABRH
Reviews.Content: My family booked 2 rooms at this hotel in early June 2009. Having stayed at other High Tech hotels, we had a reasonable idea of what to expect, and the hotel lived up to the expected standard. The hotel itself (as others have commented) is a little out of central Madrid. We did not find this a problem, as the hotel is within 2 minutes (300 feet/100 metres) of a Metro Station. With the clean, safe, cheap, and frequent Metro, you can get to any of the major sights within 10 to 20 minutes. If you don't want to travel into the centre after a long days sightseeing, there is a restaurant in the hotel, or a good choice of places within easy walking distance, There is also a good choice of shops, banks etc locally. The rooms are a good size, and come equipped (even at basic/standard level) with a large screen TV, laptop PC, and large bathroom (with a good selection of toiletories). The aircon is controllable or you can open a window. Everywhere in the hotel is kept clean. Be aware that the bads are very 'firm'. Staff at the hotel are very helpful and locked our bags away on our last day - we had a late flight home, and did not want to drag our bags around all day. All the staff we met had at least basic English - reassurring if your Spanish is a bit rusty as people in Madrid seem to speak really fast! Overall, I would recommend this hotel. Don't expect luxury, or to be in the very middle of town. Its strengths are value, good accomodation, helpful staff, and proximity to the Metro (to get anywhere quite easily).

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: goonerwong
Reviews.Content: We came back 20/04/2009 after 5 nights stay. It took about 20 minutes to get from the hotel to central Madrid, although the hotel is very close to the metro. The laptop and shower were good but the flat screen tv was less useful as we could only find CNN and Spanish channels (we are not Spanish speakers). Try not to stay on the first floor especially rooms above the main door of the hotel as you will hear it bang everytime someone goes in or out of the hotel!!!!!! We asked to be moved and were offered a second floor room. Unfortunately on the second floor we were amongst Spanish students who had no common sense regarding late hours and sound volume. They made a lot of noise by shouting across corridors and slamming their doors in the mornings and late at night. One night at 03:15 am I lost my patience and went out shouting at them to be quiet and let us get some sleep. I complained to the hotel and things got better but our holiday was spoiled. May be we were unlucky.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have stayed in while in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: tek1025
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here while traveliing through Spain. This was the best hotel I have stayed in while in Spain. The location is on a quiet residental street away from the hustle and noise of downtown Madrid. It is about 200 yards from a Metro station so you can get into downtown quickly. It is clean, modern, tastefully decorated with wood panelling in the rooms, plenty of space, flat screen TV, a laptop computer with free internet in the room, and a large bathroom with large shower. We were very impressed by this location. The staff were very friendly and efficent. We will stay here next time in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “A rare find in terms of value”
Reviews.Author: ethelstan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights in the mid July of 2008. I stayed in a double room with an elderly (my grandmother). For a background, I could consider myself a frequent traveler around Europe and have quiet an experience to compare one hotel with another. High Tech Arturo Soria would certainly be one of the best hotel Ive been in terms of good balance of money and quality. The room looks new, clean and modern. I was surprised that the room has a laptop and at least 32 inch LCD TV with full cable tv access. Another surprise was the shower which has a hydro massage shower... although It didnt work as I thought it would. There wasnt really a view from the room since our room was facing a brick walled building -- but this didnt concern us very much. The staff speaks enough English to accomodate most of your needs although I didnt ask them about any guidance in exploring Madrid. Now time for the not so pleasant aspect about this Hotel. First, the check-in was long. The receptionist took around 15 minutes just to get me a room which I pre booked in advance via Hotels.ca. She showed a relief with saying 'Finally!'. I was puzzled since they already charged full on my credit card and I already called them to secure my room with a credit card -- I cant imagine if they were not able to find me a room. Another let down is the fact that it does not have a bathtub, a kettle to boil water and that the bed quality could have been improved. The hotel location is very close to Metro Ciudad Lineal maybe less than 10 minutes walk. If you are heading straight to the city, you dont need to change line at all. The hotel is also reasonably close to the airport. It took around less than 15 minutes to travel with Car but with Metro it took around 40 minutes since you need to change train 3 times. With what I paid for (62euro per night) I think this Hotel is a rare find. Most hostels cost around 10 euro cheaper but you got massive drop in terms of quality. There are certainly other hotels at similar quality costing you 60 euro but I found all of them located in depressingly remote location. I suggest you to look no further if you dont mind the hotels to be outside a city little bit, but smackingly close to metro. I would certainly recommend this hotel to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place, possibly a five.”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous-Atlanta
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed in a room at the High Tech for one short night, gettin gin at 8 pm and leaving the next morning for the airport. The room we had was plenty large enough to accomodate us. As the name implies, the hotel is (for now) high tech. There is a laptop in the room, and the showers are modern as well. One of the beds was a fold out couch, and still comfortable. There was also an exercise bike in the room. There is some parking out front. The lobby and lounge is quite modern. A major plus for this hotel is that it is one block away from the metro stop, so getting in to and back from downtown is trivial. The hotel is also 10 minutes from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Sampuppy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was definitely adequate but there were some good and bad points ....... good points were that it was in a nice neighbourhood, close to a metro station and the reception staff were incredibly helpful!!! The bad points (although not that bad) were that the shower didn't work properly, the beds were extremely hard and the air con was noisy!! However, we had a good stay and managed to enjoy Madrid so much that I have booked to visit again in August, although i've booked a hotel with an outdoor pool this time as the weather will be so much warmer. I took my own drinks and emptied the minibar and stored them in there!! - bit cheeky but it worked!! Didn 't try the breakfast in the hotel as we preferred to get out early and we found food whilst out. Got ripped off in taxi getting to hotel in the first place - queued at the airport for 30 mins and got into a taxi who refused to go on the meter and charged 45 euros to get to the hotel. On our return to the airport we took a private minibus and it cost 36 euros - still a bit pricey but at least we knew the price before we set off!! The metro station is Cinued Lineal (or something like that) and it wasn't too far to all the places that we wanted to visit. The zoo was great and we managed to find lots of nice places to eat. We are not very adventurous eaters and so we plumped for places like TGI's and Hard Rock which suited us fine!! Our next hotel is the 'Osuna' hotel which is only a couple of stops farther out than this hotel - look out for my review on this one after 20th August!!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in Marid”
Reviews.Author: Traveller78
Reviews.Content: High Tech Arturo Soria Hotel Madrid My partner and I stayed at this hotel on three day break in September 07. The holiday was booked the night before using Lastminute and the flight was the Spanish CometAir. We had not used this airline before and it proved to be a fast and efficient service. They gave out free drinks and nuts or biscuits, and sweets. We came through Madrid Barajas International Airport, and used the Metro to get to the hotel. To save changing trains four times we got off at Arturo Soria Metro station and walked about the 1 mile down the main road towards the Hotel. It surprised me as to how peaceful the walk in the sunshine was down the wide tree lined path next to the main road. After getting to know the Metro system we should have gone straight to the nearest Metro station, Cludad Lineal, as it is a two minute walk to the hotel from there. The Metro is bright, clean, safe, and the maps are easy to follow. We purchased a 10 journey ticket at 6.40 Euros from the dispensing machine at the Airport station entrance, and validated it for two people. When the first person goes through the barrier it is passed back to the second person to use. However, there is a 1 Euro surcharge to be paid to get into the Metro system at the Airport, and very annoyingly on our return home, a 1 Euro surcharge to leave the Metro system at the airport. People having to pay the 1 Euro fee to leave the Metro system at the airport was causing much commotion amongst travellers who were not expecting to pay a fee to leave the Metro system. It takes 18 minutes to get to the centre of Madrid, Callao, from the hotel by Metro, and there are no changes necessary, so the journey is very easy to do. The hotel is located in a very quiet residential area. In many places at home in the UK the yobs come out in the evening and hang about on the street. However, around the hotel it was the opposite, older folk come out in the evening and sit on chairs and chat way, playing cards, etc. It all leads to the feeling of a safe environment. The hotel is small, about 40 rooms, very clean and tidy, our room 204, being at the back of the hotel was so very quiet. In fact there was no noise of any sort to be heard while in the room. The air con was very efficient and the windows open if you want to have fresh air. The room had a queen sized bed which was very comfortable, telephone, flat screen TV, the only English channel was CNN News, free safe deposit box that works off your credit or debit card magnetic information strip, a mini bar. A down side was the lack of in room tea and coffee, although it could be ordered as room service. The toilet room was fitted with a body hydro shower unit, one of those that has about ten water jets that can be tuned on or off along the length of your body. A hair dryer, a good range of complimentary toiletries, the stylish modern glass and stainless steel sink unit does not have a plug – so bring your own. It is much nicer to wash from a basin of water in stead of running water, also it is more efficient as not so much water is used. The help yourself unlimited breakfast was enough to give us a good start to the day offering all the usual foods and drinks. The breakfast area looked small but worked well and we felt comfortable. There is free internet access via hotel PC’s or wireless on your own laptop. On the relaxing terrace bar which is at the front of the hotel, do try the refreshing sangria at about 6 Euros for two people that comes with olives and crisps. It is a very refreshing drink and you can watch the world go by in this relaxing area. This hotel does not have a garden to sit in or too stroll around. The hotel seems ideal for the business man as it has all you might need in a secure, small and compact way, and for people on a long weekend away, we enjoyed our stay at the hotel. Perhaps next time we would like to stay a little closer to the centre of Madrid to save on the 18 minute journey time into the centre by Metro. However, the hotel is in a nice quiet, clean, and safe area. All in all, a nice hotel with a good connection to the centre of Madrid by Metro – 18 minutes and 1 Euro. Buy a 10 journey ticket for 6.40 euros its cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, Quiet & a Metro Ride”
Reviews.Author: Verdad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here our last night in Spain, after travelling back from the Costa Blanca, so we wouldn't have a long trip to the airport the next morning. We had a car - free parking, right out in front of the hotel, which was a welcome surprise. The drive is about ten minutes to the airport. The interior was pleasant, room was spacious and clean, bathroom had a great hydromassage shower. It had the look of a business hotel, and we saw groups of what looked like business travellers. The outside terrace was nice to sit and have a drink. It is in a residential area, but knowing Madrid (I used to live here), it's a nice area - where you will find the "real Madrid". It is a pretty area, with tree lined avenues and friendly shops and restaurants close by. You can take the metro to all the tourists sites - it's really not that long of a ride - look at the metro map and judge for yourself (the hotel would be at stop "Arturo Soria"). To do it again, I might stay here in Madrid, not near the Plaza Mayor, because you can visit the tourist sites there, and then escape back to the tranquility of this neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Good out of town location”
Reviews.Author: PersianUK
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, nice area with friendly and helpful staff. Showers were excellent and beds very comfortable, however TV in room had no English speaking channels. Good free access to internet in the reception. Rooms were clean but could hear next door coughing all night! Brilliant sandwich shop around the corner and fantastic links to the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a fantastic base for exploring Madrid. The staff spoke good English which was helpful as our spanish needs a little work! The room was very clean and quite spacious, the bathroom was very good. Spain was a having a heat-wave when we were there and the room was fully air conditioned which was heaven, considering it was 40C outside. Breakfast gave a good variety, from fruit and cereal to bacon and pastries (try one of the custard danishes - they're amazing) the staff didn't even mind if they noticed you slipping fruit or pastries up to your room for later. There is a terrace bar out the front, serving delicious sangria and spanish beer at a very reasonable rate. As soon as we sat down we were presented with little plates of free tapas including delicious meats, olives and crisp things, and the staff came and replenished them every time we finished! They also serve dinner here and the seafood is amazing. It really tasted fresh and had been cooked to perfection. All the locals come here to eat and drink later in the evening which shows it must be good! The hotel is slightly far out of the city but is served well by the metro (underground) and has a huge shopping centre just up the road. We found our way easily from the airport on the metro and could access everywhere we wanted to go on the tube network. I was a little nervous about using the metro but its so cheap if you buy a five-day ticket and it was really clean, easy to navigate and by far the quickest way to get around the city. Being a bit further out of the centre means you can sit outside in the evening without the noise of the city centre, and there are a couple of other pubs (including an Irish one) just up the road if you don't want to stay in the hotel in the evening. the metro runs late so there's no problem getting to the city centre if you want a big night out. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and hope to go back myself.

Reviews.Title: “Way out of the way”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was adequate, espcially for the business traveler. Somewhere I read that it was close to the airport. Not so. It was in a residential neighborhood, with major traffric. Hard to get to from the airport and not very close to downtown either. The staff was pleasant but not terribly helpful. I would only stay here again if I had to be in this particular part of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: peppie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week for a three night midweek break. Located just in the residental part of Madrid, although on a main road, it was very quiet. One min walk away from the Metro ! A perfect location. The hotel was spotless and the staff very friendly. Fully air conditioned with fantastic showers. There is a nice "porch" outside which is open in the evening for meals or a drink which is nice when you don't fancy going into town. I would have no problem staying there again, and hopefully will!

Reviews.Title: “best deal High Tec Arturo Soria”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just staid 2 nights in this hotel and it is a real good deal, depending on how you book it.I am a travel agent and go to Madrid about 8 times a year. This was definitely the best deal I ever had in this cityAs few as 65Eur per night a double room with a buffet breakfast (small but everything was fresh & tasty) rooms are spacious & fine/clean bathroom.Minibar and bar drinks are rather expensiveIt is quiet up north the city center so for exclusive tourist visits it could be considered a bit far.Has a fine parkinglot up front the hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: High Tech Arturo Soria
HotelInfo.Address: Arturo Soria 14, 28027 Madrid, Spain
